title: Trevor Story decides to stay with Red Sox, won’t opt out of contract
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Trevor Story will remain with the Boston Red Sox, opting not to leave his contract's final two years.
Story played 157 games in 2025, hitting .263 with 25 home runs and 96 RBIs after overcoming past injuries.
Story's decision influences the Red Sox's infield planning, potentially shifting him to second base for 2026.

title: Marat Khusnutdinov keeps cashing in on his opportunities with Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the lone goal for Boston Bruins in a shootout victory against the New York Islanders.
Khusnutdinov has tallied two goals in his last three games, stepping up in Elias Lindholm's absence.
Coach Marco Sturm trusts Khusnutdinov's abilities, using him effectively in key moments despite initial lineup rotation.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Nov. 5)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Acton's 16 Silver Hill Road, built in 1979, sold for $1,160,000 on a 67,082-square-foot lot.
Arlington saw a high sale with 57 Hodge Road, a 1952 Cape Cod, selling for $2,275,000.
Billerica's 178 Andover Road, built in 2022, sold for $1,100,000 on a 68,825-square-foot lot.

title: ‘Landslide’: Santana beats out Baker, Wu says, while Culpepper wins D7
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Rev. Miniard Culpepper won Boston City Council's District 7 seat, defeating Said Ahmed by approximately 500 votes.
At-Large City Councilor Henry Santana secured reelection, defeating challenger Frank Baker and joining other incumbents returning to the council.
All incumbents in the Boston City Council elections were reelected, including District 1's Gabriela Coletta Zapata and District 4's Brian Worrell.

title: Jake Wilson to be Somerville’s next mayor, unofficial results show
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: City Councilor Jake Wilson received 11,185 votes in Somerville's mayoral race, surpassing opponent Willie Burnley Jr. with 9,054 votes.
Wilson's campaign focused on improving city services and addressing issues like housing, street safety, and rodent problems.
Outgoing Mayor Katjana Ballantyne did not advance past the September preliminary election, paving the way for Wilson's win.

title: Lowell police seeking public’s help with details about fatal hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lowell police seek public assistance in a fatal hit-and-run case from Oct. 30 on Chelmsford Street.
A woman was struck and killed by a vehicle that fled before she received emergency treatment and was pronounced dead.
The vehicle involved has been identified but further public information is requested; contact Lowell police at 978-937-3200.

title: ‘This is just the beginning’: Nonbinding Israel divestment ballot question passes in Somerville
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Somerville voters passed a nonbinding ballot measure advocating for divestment from companies involved with Israel's actions in Palestine.
The measure received 55.7% support, with 11,489 votes for and 7,920 against out of the total votes cast.
Efforts by Somerville United Against Discrimination to remove Question 3 from the ballot were denied by Middlesex Superior Court.

title: Tom Brady just revealed that his dog Junie is a clone of Lua, his deceased furry friend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Tom Brady revealed that his new dog Junie is a clone of his late dog Lua, with the help of Colossal Biosciences.
Brady invested in Colossal Biosciences, a company which recently acquired Viagen, known for animal cloning expertise.
Lua, Brady's former dog, was often seen with him and featured in a 2014 UGG commercial.

title: Running unopposed, Michelle Wu secures second term as her national profile grows
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Michelle Wu secured her second term as Boston mayor, running unopposed and achieving 91.10% of the vote.
Wu previously defeated opponent Josh Kraft by nearly 50 points in a preliminary race; Kraft withdrew shortly after.
Wu gained national attention with her testimony to Congress, emphasizing Boston's policies and critiquing the Trump administration.

title: Tell us: What should Mayor Wu focus on in her second term?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu is expected to secure a second term in Boston after running unopposed in the general election.
Wu's first term focused on issues like housing affordability, climate goals, and public safety while maintaining 'sanctuary city' policies.
Boston.com seeks community input on what Wu should prioritize in her second term, including transit, climate, and immigration.
